item.title: 335 – Jabberwock
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Jabberwock A house divided stands in a yellow wood at two roads, diverging You cannot serve both God & money—you will love and hate both.   Goblet or simple cup? You have chosen poorly. The better angels of our natures … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Jabberwock

A house divided stands
in a yellow wood
at two roads, diverging

You cannot serve both
God & money—you will
love and hate both.  

Goblet or simple cup?
You have chosen
poorly.

The better angels
of our natures
are pinioned.

Even kings
end up buried
in parking lots.

Some days
call for the
Jabberwock.

Not all
who wander
are lost.

Why
so
serious?

There
is no
spoon.

This too
shall
pass.

item.title: 334 – Blessing (Work)
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Blessing (Work) Man I can’t help But think of Adam That third morning East of the Garden. Up with the sun To another uncertain Day of labor, the same As yesterday. Welcome To the world. Shit. So thank the LORD For … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Blessing (Work)

Man I can’t help
But think of Adam
That third morning
East of the Garden.
Up with the sun
To another uncertain
Day of labor, the same
As yesterday. Welcome
To the world. Shit.

So thank the LORD
For a day of rest
To wash my mouth
Of cursing my blind eyes
Dusty with the world
Dig out the hard dirt
Under fingernails
& breathe.

How God knew
What man needed
(Not being man): mystery
Yet it is right & good
To pause & worship
In whatever way
Seems best. So I’ll stop
Take bread & wine

& sing myself to sleep
Tonight giving thanks
For a body that works
A head full of thick dreams
& the hope of waking
Another day to a life
Worth rising to.

item.title: 333 – Blessing (Hands)
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Blessing (Hands) Then, winter comes on & you can’t make a fist. Your gearing mashed & torn, soldered to an eagle’s claw. All day long you are building a fire in your hands, rubbing constantly, feeling coming slowly, a communiqué … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Blessing (Hands)

Then, winter comes on
& you can’t make a fist.
Your gearing mashed & torn,
soldered to an eagle’s claw.
All day long you are building
a fire in your hands, rubbing
constantly, feeling coming slowly,
a communiqué from headquarters
out to the war-ravaged front lines.
No reinforcements. No supplies.
No surrender. You dig in, storing
up, delegating as good generals do.
When at last all is made good, you salute
flat-handed & firm, tight to the brow.
A gesture unequivocal. No surrender.

item.title: 332 – Blessing (Winter Garden)
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Blessing (Winter Garden) I used to know you By mouth-feel Name Of Stones I knew Your cut edges Blood-drawn tongue- Swollen sharp click Against teeth You were A second vine in me Climbing the rungs Of my bone trellis known … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Blessing (Winter Garden)

I used to know you
By mouth-feel Name
Of Stones I knew
Your cut edges
Blood-drawn tongue-
Swollen sharp click
Against teeth You were

A second vine in me
Climbing the rungs
Of my bone trellis known
Intimate now withering
Or simply gone under
-Ground dormant

You’ll sprout
Some fine day
In my hands’ cracks
Or so I hope, watching
The dead garden
All winter long
Waiting

item.title: 331 – Presently Absent
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Presently Absent I imagine you star-fishing in our bed alone spread out to take up as much space as possible. Claim the sheets shoo their empty shirring I too am reaching every dark corner of this hotel bed. It’s fun … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Presently Absent

I imagine you

star-fishing
in our bed

alone

spread out
to take up

as much space
as possible.

Claim the sheets

shoo
their empty
shirring

I too am
reaching

every dark corner
of this hotel
bed.

It’s fun

for only so long.

Sleep well.

item.title: 330 – Good Lord Bird
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Good Lord Bird We came to eat him up, that Tom. Man-handled his breast-heavy body into the pan. Juiced him. Laid in carrots, onion, celery. Let him roast all day, steaming up the windows. Crescented rolls. Whipped Jell-O. Yams from a can. … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Good Lord Bird

We came to eat him up, that Tom.
Man-handled his breast-heavy
body into the pan. Juiced him.
Laid in carrots, onion, celery.
Let him roast all day, steaming
up the windows. Crescented rolls.
Whipped Jell-O. Yams from a can.
Jellied fat congealing. We supped
and supped again. We argued Scrabble
scores and dichotomy (ie?). Drank more
wine and set belts aside. Told old stories
no one could quite agree on. Pride
of place: competing pies, pumpkin
and dried-out apple. We at them anyway.
Fought sleep, nodded, dozed in and out,
then rested eyelids slumped against one anther
on the couch, woke to a thankful cat
on the counter, picking her way
through the left out leftovers
of the Good Lord Bird.

item.title: 329 – Family System
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Family System Wanna know how I got these scars? Any of a thousand hurts. My father was a drinker and a fiend. The sharks carved up my wife. It’s a lie either way. Why so serious? God in or out of the machine. Some … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Family System

Wanna know how I got these scars?

Any of a thousand hurts.

My father was a drinker and a fiend. The sharks

carved up my wife. It’s a lie either way. 

Why so serious? God

in or out of the machine. Some men

just want to watch the world burn.

We’re destined to do this forever,

you and I.

 

*italicized quotes from “The Dark Knight”

item.title: 328 – Blessing (RLA)
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Blessing (RLA) I don’t cry about A. until later. I am blindsided, his sharp blades under my hands. He is shaking mechanical grapples me in with his eyes closed. We breathe together. All our sadnesses the same. Smells of cigarettes, cedar pitch. I … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Blessing (RLA)

I don’t cry about A.
until later. I am blindsided,
his sharp blades under my hands.
He is shaking mechanical
grapples me in with his eyes
closed. We breathe together.
All our sadnesses the same.
Smells of cigarettes, cedar pitch.
I know the bend of his ribs;
his fingers find the thin line
of my collarbone. We hold.
Hold. Hold. He releases
automatic reset for the next
blind lunge at love. I stagger
into a hundred others reaching
out. Christ’s cloak torn. I lean
to each and every hand as I am
able. I am not able.

item.title: 327 – Doppelgänger
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Doppelgänger a dark lake reaches to the back steps when the rains come the linden shakes itself free leaves floating sunken bright eyes under clear skin our eyes reflected there almond amber green eyes look leaves lying a heron come to stand above himself … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Doppelgänger

a dark lake reaches
to the back steps
when the rains come

the linden shakes
itself free leaves
floating sunken

bright eyes under
clear skin our eyes
reflected there

almond amber
green eyes look
leaves lying

a heron come
to stand above
himself hunt

the waving grasses
our hands spread
stars or fish

item.title: 326 – Blessing (Veil)
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Blessing (Veil) all is mist no use for fists’ slick emptiness birds call to birds invisible hands like knives against the skin of the the world the veil tears and mends how will we find one another?
item.content:encoded:
Blessing (Veil)

all is mist
no use for fists’
slick emptiness

birds call
to birds
invisible

hands like knives
against the skin
of the the world

the veil tears
and mends how
will we find one another?
